intro: Talauma minor subsp. orbiculata, commonly known as the orbiculate talauma, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its fruits are small berries that mature to a dark red color, containing several seeds. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
